citeinfo.origin: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries
citeinfo.title: Kyongsong or Seoul (Keijo) Kyonggi-do (Keiki-do), Korea, 1946

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the 1946 paper map entitled: Kyongsong or Seoul (Keijo) Kyonggi-do (Keiki-do), Korea, published by the United States Army Map Service. The map was scanned at 300 dots per inch and is in the TIFF format.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. This image may be used in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: In margin: Korea city plans ... Kysongsong [!] Korea. "Polyconic projection." Military grid. "Contour interval 10 meters ... Depths in meters." Three classes of roads, three classes of railroads, and areas of vegetation and cultivation are shown. Administrative units and some buildings are named. "Korean names transcribed according to the McCune-Reischauer system, Japanese forms of Korean names (shown in parentheses) transcribed according to the modified Hepburn (Romaji) system." Includes "Glossary." Inset: Index to sources. On verso: Administrative unit names ... and locations ... correct to 1943.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.

procstep.procdesc: Original map was scanned at 300 dpi and saved in .tiff format with Colortrac5480 Scanner
